sourceText: Vishnu Purana; Brihat Parashara Hora Shastra; Surya Siddhanta
period: c. 2nd c BCE – 5th c CE (Alexandrian contact onward; codified 7th–10th c CE)
note: Two parallel systems: the Seven Lokas (planes of existence ascending from Earth to Brahma's realm) and the Navagraha (nine planetary bodies with their deities, archetypes, and gemstones). Rahu and Ketu are the shadow planets — the lunar nodes — placed below the seven classical correspondences.

Rahu / Ketu.archetype: Rahu: obsession, worldly desire, illusion / Ketu: liberation, detachment, past lives
Rahu / Ketu.stone: Rahu: Hessonite Garnet (Gomed) / Ketu: Cat's Eye (Lehsunia)
Rahu / Ketu.loka: Patala — the netherworlds, below the seven lokas

Saturn.god: Shani Deva (son of Surya and Chhaya)
Saturn.archetype: Discipline, karma, suffering, endurance, the taskmaster
Saturn.loka: Bhu-loka — the Earth plane, the physical world

Venus.archetype: Beauty, pleasure, love, art, material wealth, the poet
Venus.loka: Bhuvar-loka — the atmospheric plane, the astral realm

Jupiter.archetype: Wisdom, expansion, teaching, dharma, the priest-sage
Jupiter.loka: Svar-loka — the celestial plane, heaven of the gods

Mercury.archetype: Intellect, communication, trade, adaptability, the messenger
Mercury.loka: Mahar-loka — the plane of great saints and sages

Mars.archetype: Courage, war, energy, action, the warrior
Mars.loka: Jana-loka — the plane of the mind-born sons of Brahma

Moon.archetype: Mind, emotions, intuition, nurturing, the queen
Moon.loka: Tapo-loka — the plane of austerity and tapas

Sun.god: Surya Deva (the Sun god, father of Manu)
Sun.archetype: Soul, authority, vitality, truth, the king
Sun.loka: Satya-loka (Brahma-loka) — the plane of truth, Brahma's realm
